text: Municipal elections were held in the Czech Republic on 1 and 2 November 1998. The Civic Democratic Party received the most votes, although the Christian and Democratic Union – Czechoslovak People's Party won more seats. ==Results== {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|Civic Democratic Party | 20,360,211 | 25.23 | 5,729 |- |align=left|Czech Social Democratic Party | 12,575,626 | 15.58 | 4,666 |- |align=left|Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia | 11 696 976 | 14.49 | 5,702 |- |align=left|Christian and Democratic Union – Czechoslovak People's Party | 7,728,402 | 9.58 | 6,013 |- |align=left|Freedom Union – Democratic Union | 2,648,568 | 3.28 | 452 |} ==References== 2002 Category:2002 elections in the Czech Republic Category:November 2002 events in Europe
title: 2002 Czech municipal elections
